org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api

Interface MutableTransactionConfiguration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ChronoDBTransaction.Configuration, TransactionConfigurationInternal
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultTransactionConfiguration

    public interface MutableTransactionConfiguration
extends TransactionConfigurationInternal
    The mutable portion of a ChronoDBTransaction.Configuration.

    This class is not part of the public API. Down-casting a configuration to this class means leaving the public API.

    This class contains methods that are intended for building up the configuration. Once the construction is complete, freeze() should be called to make the configuration unmodifiable.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.TransactionConfigurationInternal

        getBranch, getTimestamp, isTimestampNow

      • Methods inherited from interface org.chronos.chronodb.api.ChronoDBTransaction.Configuration

        getDuplicateVersionEliminationMode, isBlindOverwriteProtectionEnabled, isReadOnly, isThreadSafe

    • Method Detail

      • setBranch

        void setBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Sets the name of the branch on which the resulting transaction should operate.

        By default, this is set to ChronoDBConstants.MASTER_BRANCH_IDENTIFIER.

        Parameters:
        branchName - The branch name. Must not be null.

      • setTimestamp

        void setTimestamp(long timestamp)
        Sets the timestamp on which the resulting transaction should operate.

        By default, this is set to the "now" timestamp of the branch. To reset it to the now timestamp after calling this method, please use setTimestampToNow().

        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp. Must not be negative.

      • setTimestampToNow

        void setTimestampToNow()
        Sets the timestamp on which the resulting transaction should operate to the "now" timestamp of the target branch.

      • setThreadSafe

        void setThreadSafe(boolean threadSafe)
        Enables or disables thread-safety on this transaction.

        Important note: ChronoDB instances themselves are always thread-safe. This property only determines if the resulting ChronoDBTransaction itself may be shared among multiple threads or not.

        Parameters:
        threadSafe - Set this to true if thread-safety on the transaction itself is required, otherwise set it to false to disable thread-safety.

      • setBlindOverwriteProtectionEnabled

        void setBlindOverwriteProtectionEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables blind overwrite protection on this transaction.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Set this to true to enable blind overwrite protection, or to false in order to disable it.

      • setDuplicateVersionEliminationMode

        void setDuplicateVersionEliminationMode(DuplicateVersionEliminationMode mode)
        Sets the DuplicateVersionEliminationMode on this transaction.
        Parameters:
        mode - The mode to use. Must not be null.

      • setReadOnly

        void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Sets the read-only mode of this transaction configuration.
        Parameters:
        readOnly - Set this to true if the transaction should be read-only, or to false if it should be read-write.

      • freeze

        void freeze()
        "Freezes" the configuration.

        After calling this method, no further modifications to the transaction configuration will be allowed.
